Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek pottery deep bowl or cup; dull cream slip; interior glazed with bands in added white and added red below rim and near bottom of sherd; exterior: at rim, frieze of short vertical lines, some in added red; below, two narrow bands; below, painted decoration consisting of lotus flower with red on kalyx and petals between two inverted lotus buds; short strokes, losenges, and dotted rosette as filling ornament; at right, two narrow vertical lines on either side of vertical row of single dots; to right, part of zigzag line; below, row of dots between bands and undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.117)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (26, pl. 18, 22)
